question: Two aircraft have the same wing shape and area if one has straight wings and the other swept wings how will the aspect ratios of the two aircraft compare?

choices.choice: Aspect ratio will increase as wings stveepback angle increases
Aspect ratio will decrease as wing sweepback angle increases.
Depends on the C of G position.

subject: Technical

question: Which wing plan forms are most susceptible to tip stall?

choices.choice: High aspect ratio, elliptical, Low taper ratio, straight.
High aspect ratio, pointed, high taper ratio, swept.
Low aspect ratio, elliptical, low taper ratio, straight.
Low aspect ratio, pointed, low taper ratio, swept.

subject: Technical

question: Which of the following are true of low aspect ratio rectangular wings?

choices.choice: They produce low induced drag and high profile drag.
They produce low profile drag and high induced drag.
They are difficult to construct and their roots stall before their tips.
'They are easy to construct and their tips stall before their roots.

subject: Technical

question: In what direction is the airflow deflected as it passes over the tips of lift generating pointed wings.
subject: Technical

It poses structural problems making design and construction difficult. , 3. The aircraft exhibits little or no pre-stall buffet. 4. Aileron effectiveness is reduced close to the stall.

question: Which of the following statements best describes the effect of reducing aspect ratio?

choices.choice: The slope of the CL:a curve decreases and stalling angle increases.
The slope of the CL:a curve decreases and stalling angle decreases
The slope of the CL:a curve increase and stalling angle increases.
The slope of the CL:a curve increase and stalling angle decreases.

subject: Technical

question: Which of the following is the most accurate definition of dihedral angle?

choices.choice: The horizontal angle between the 25% chord line and the lateral axis.
The vertical angle between the longitudinal axis and the wing spar.
The vertical angle between the wing plane and tlie lateral axis.
The angle between the chord line and the longitudinal axis.

subject: Technical

question: What are the angle of incidence and incidence respectively?

choices.choice: The angle between the chord line and the longitudinal axis and the angle of attack respectively.
The angle of attack and the angle between the chord line and the normal axis.
The angle between the chord line and the longitudinal axis, and between the chord line and the free stream airflow respectively.

subject: Technical

question: What is the relationship between the mean camber line and the chord line of a symmetrical aerofoil?

choices.choice: They are closest at the mid chord point.

subject: Technical

question: What is the principal cause of deep stall?

choices.choice: Tip stalling of swept back wings.

subject: Technical

question: How is the aspect ratio of a wing of complex plan form calculated?
subject: Technical

question: What is the angle of attack?

choices.choice: The angle between the chord line and the longitudinal axis.
The angle between the chord line and the relative airflow.
The angle between the chord line and the free stream airflow.
The angle between the total reaction and the chord line.

subject: Technical

question: How does a supercritical aerofoil compare with a convention design?

choices.choice: Thinner, more cambered and convex under rear surface.
Thicker, less cambered and concave under rear surface.
Thinner, less cambered and concave under rear surface.
Thicker, more cambered and convex under rear surface.

subject: Technical

question: What effect will increasing aspect ratio have on drag at low and high speeds?

choices.choice: Decrease profile at low speeds and increase induced at high speeds.
Decrease induced at low speeds, no effect at high speeds.
Increases induced at low speed and decrease induced at high speeds.
Decrease induced and increase profile at all speeds.

subject: Technical

question: What effect will increasing aspect ratio have on stalling angle?

choices.choice: Increase or decrease depending on weight.

subject: Technical

question: What effect will increasing aspect ratio have on stalling speed?

choices.choice: Increase or decrease depending on weight.

subject: Technical

question: Why do aircraft with swept back wings pitch up in the stall?

choices.choice: C of P moves outward and forward.
C of P moves inward and forward.

question: How does the CL:a curve of a swept wing compare with that of a straight wing?

question: How does the stalling angle of a swept wing compare with that of a straight wing of equal section?

choices.choice: Higher or lower depending on weight.

question: How would the stalling speed of a swept wing compare with that of a straight wing of equal section?

choices.choice: Higher or lower depending on altitude.

question: Divergence is caused by……….?

C of P aft of torsional axis, thin wings and excessive thrust.

choices.choice: Between camber line and longitudinal axis.
Between chord line and longitudinal axis.
